intro: Leiochilus, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, often delicate flowers and their ability to thrive in rocky or mountainous environments. They are typically found in temperate regions and are adapted to grow in well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and color variations. Leiochilus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological role in their native habitats.
